explanation_composer.regulatory_rule_cue:
SOLAS Chapter V, Regulation 19 — Mandatory AIS Operation in Designated Waterways (applicable to cargo vessels navigating near major shipping lanes including Romsø Fyr and the Great Belt)
Operational Protocol Rationale: Cargo vessels operating under engine power in this region typically maintain straight, steady trajectories along predefined maritime routes to comply with traffic separation schemes and ensure safe passage through congested or environmentally sensitive areas. The observed stable speed, minimal course deviation, and precise heading control reflect standard autopilot-assisted transit behavior consistent with open-water segments of major shipping lanes. This pattern rules out maneuvering, anchoring, or port approaches, which would show variable speeds or erratic headings. The westward linear progression aligns with established routing measures in the Great Belt corridor, where vessels of this size and draught are expected to follow fixed tracks for collision avoidance and navigational efficiency.
